orestes.bloomfilter

Interface BloomFilter<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CountingBloomFilter<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BloomFilterMemory, BloomFilterRedis, CountingBloomFilterMemory, CountingBloomFilterRedis, ExpiringBloomFilter

    public interface BloomFilter<T>
extends java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    Represents a Bloom filter and provides default methods for hashing.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        boolean add(byte[] element)
        Adds the passed value to the filter.
        Parameters:
        element - value to add
        Returns:
        true if the value did not previously exist in the filter. Note, that a false positive may occur, thus the value may not have already been in the filter, but it hashed to a set of bits already in the filter.

      • add

        default boolean add(T element)
        Adds the passed value to the filter.
        Parameters:
        element - value to add
        Returns:
        true if the value did not previously exist in the filter. Note, that a false positive may occur, thus the value may not have already been in the filter, but it hashed to a set of bits already in the filter.

        Returns:
        a list of booleans indicating for each element, whether it was previously present in the filter

      • getFalsePositiveProbability

        default double getFalsePositiveProbability()
        Returns the expected false positive probability for the expected amounts of elements. This is independent of the actual amount of elements in the filter. Use getFalsePositiveProbability(double) for that purpose.
        Returns:
        the static expected false positive probability

      • hash

        default int[] hash(java.lang.String value)
        Dispatches the hash function for a string value
        Parameters:
        value - the value to be hashed
        Returns:
        array with hashes integer hash positions in the range [0,size)

      • union

        boolean union(BloomFilter<T> other)
        Performs the union operation on two compatible bloom filters. This is achieved through a bitwise OR operation on their bit vectors. This operations is lossless, i.e. no elements are lost and the bloom filter is the same that would have resulted if all elements wer directly inserted in just one bloom filter.
        Parameters:
        other - the other bloom filter
        Returns:
        true if this bloom filter could successfully be updated through the union with the provided bloom filter

      • intersect

        boolean intersect(BloomFilter<T> other)
        Performs the intersection operation on two compatible bloom filters. This is achieved through a bitwise AND operation on their bit vectors. The operations doesn't introduce any false negatives but it does raise the false positive probability. The the false positive probability in the resulting Bloom filter is at most the false-positive probability in one of the constituent bloom filters
        Parameters:
        other - the other bloom filter
        Returns:
        true if this bloom filter could successfully be updated through the intersection with the provided bloom filter

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if the Bloom filter does not contain any elements
        Returns:
        true if the Bloom filter does not contain any elements

      • getFalsePositiveProbability

        default double getFalsePositiveProbability(double insertedElements)
        Returns the probability of a false positive (approximated):
        (1 - e^(-hashes * insertedElements / size)) ^ hashes
        Parameters:
        insertedElements - The number of elements already inserted into the Bloomfilter
        Returns:
        probability of a false positive after expectedElements add(byte[]) operations

      • getEstimatedFalsePositiveProbability

        default double getEstimatedFalsePositiveProbability()
        Returns the probability of a false positive (approximated) using an estimation of how many elements are currently in the filter
        Returns:
        probability of a false positive

      • getBitsPerElement

        default double getBitsPerElement(int n)
        Calculates the numbers of Bits per element, based on the expected number of inserted elements expectedElements.
        Parameters:
        n - The number of elements already inserted into the Bloomfilter
        Returns:
        The numbers of bits per element

      • getBitZeroProbability

        default double getBitZeroProbability(int n)
        Returns the probability that a bit is zero.
        Parameters:
        n - The number of elements already inserted into the Bloomfilter
        Returns:
        probability that a certain bit is zero after expectedElements add(byte[]) operations

      • getEstimatedPopulation

        default java.lang.Double getEstimatedPopulation()
        Estimates the current population of the Bloom filter (see: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bloom_filter#Approximating_the_number_of_items_in_a_Bloom_filter )
        Returns:
        the estimated amount of elements in the filter
